meanings.definition: A widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The movie relied on stereotyping to portray the villain as always wearing black and being mean.
meanings.sent2: Stereotyping can lead to misunderstandings and unfair judgments about individuals.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit exaggerated stereotyping by showing all scientists as wearing lab coats and glasses.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the author used stereotyping to create a character who was always late and forgetful.
meanings.sent5: The children's book aimed to break the cycle of stereotyping by showcasing diverse friendships.

meanings.definition: To view or represent as a stereotype.
meanings.sent1: She was stereotyping her classmates by assuming they all liked the same music.
meanings.sent2: People should avoid stereotyping others based on their appearance or background.
meanings.sent3: The detective mistakenly stereotyped the suspect as the only one capable of the crime.
meanings.sent4: By stereotyping individuals, we limit our ability to see their unique qualities and talents.
meanings.sent5: The artist challenged societal norms by stereotyping traditional gender roles in their paintings.
